pr_title: [test] Polish tests that use nano durations to avoid flakkyness

timeline.message: [test] Polish tests that use nano durations to avoid flakkyness

timeline.bodyText: This one particular change seems weird to me. The rest is ok.
timeline.author: ericbottard

replies.bodyText: real time tests that use nanosecond precision for both scheduling (delays) and timeouts are prone to become flakky at the smallest of host hiccups (OS is busy when the timeout is scheduled, for instance). Having two different orders of magnitude ensures that such a hiccup during block wouldn't result in a test failure.
replies.author: simonbasle
